intro: Serratula seoanei, commonly known as the Spanish tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and grasslands. Its yellowish flowers are surrounded by narrow, pointed leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. Serratula seoanei is also known for its medicinal properties, though it can be toxic if ingested in large quantities.
